title: Rebekah Vardy’s former I’m A Celeb campmates have their say on Coleen Rooney row
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest I'm a Celebrity stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Rebekah Vardy 's I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here campmates have spoken out amid her war with Coleen Rooney.

Coleen accused someone behind Rebekah Vardy's Instagram account of leaking stories about her, claims the pregnant star vehemently denies.

Now Becky's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here 2017 co-stars have had their say on the very public showdown.

Comedian Shappi Khorsandi and Ian Lee took to Twitter to share their thoughts on the row that everyone is talking about.

Shappi, 46, tweeted: "BaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhARGHGHGHGHGHGH!!!!!! I'm not commenting... I'm keeping a dignified silence but I will tell you, IT'S SO [expletive] HARD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"

A friend of the author quizzed: “WHAT DO YOU KNOW? DM ME INSTANTLY. (Obv).”

The joker then micro-blogged: "I prefer not to speak. If I speak, I am in big trouble.”

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

Iain Lee, 46, also weighed in on Twitter - two years after Rebekah was accused of "ganging up on him" during their time down under.

He said: “[Expletive] thing and all and most of you know I'm not a fan but struggling to pile on to a pregnant woman. Dunno. Am I being silly?"

The comments come after the wife of footballer Wayne Rooney - dubbed 'WAGatha Christie' - caused a social media storm on Wednesday after revealing how she turned detective to catch the mole that betrayed her trust.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: ITV)

The Liverpudlian native, 33, sparked a social media frenzy when she accused someone behind Rebekah Vardy's Instagram account of selling stories about her.

Coleen told her followers how she had planted a series of false stories on her private Instagram page that was only accessible to view by Rebekah's account.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Getty Images)

Vardy immediately denied Coleen's claims and said she felt 'disgusted' that she was forced into doing so.

After firing off a defensive statement, where she insisted she 'doesn't exactly need the money', Vardy has since recruited forensic experts to look into exactly who has been accessing her Instagram account to prove her innocence.

In the last 24 hours she has also been publicly shaming trolls and hitting back at her critics.
description: Some of the WAG's I'm A Celeb co-stars have voiced their thoughts on the spat
